{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3003926,"name":"William","username":"WilliamB","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/w/6bbea6/{size}.png","created_at":"2022-02-06T20:00:43.796Z","cooked":"

repo
I’m trying to use opencv with kotlin for a robotics project but since opencv doesn’t have a maven package for their library I have to use the jar file they have. I have included the jar file locally and added it via implementation(fileTree("vendor/")). Then in Main.kt I have System.loadLibrary(Core.NATIVE_LIBRARY_NAME) and according to these files from team 401 that’s all I need to do. I am able to build and IDEA gives me completion for org.opencv packages but when I try and run I get Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsatisfiedLinkError: no opencv_java455 in java.library.path. From what I’ve read my best guess is that I need to somehow also link to the native libraries for opencv. So I tried and added it to the java.library.path(tried with both shared and static AND tried adding lib and .so/a prefix/suffixes to Core.NATIVE_LIBRARY_NAME) but still nothing. Even if that did work I’d be confused as to how the “team401” project worked since they only linked the jar file as far as I can tell. Also even if it did work would I have to cross compiling opencv for all the platforms I want to use it on(defeating the purpose of moving to kotlin imo)?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":5,"updated_at":"2022-02-06T20:00:43.796Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":502,"reads":29,"readers_count":28,"score":2520.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":402336,"topic_slug":"unable-to-link-local-opencv-jar-file-in-gradle","display_username":"William","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://github.com/team401/2018-Robot-Code/blob/master/vision/build.gradle","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":4},{"url":"https://github.com/rr1706/Vision2022","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":2},{"url":"https://github.com/team401/2018-Robot-Code/blob/master/vision/src/main/kotlin/org/team401/vision2018/Vision.kt","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":2}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49405,"hidden":false,"trust_level":1,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"post_url":"/t/unable-to-link-local-opencv-jar-file-in-gradle/402336/1","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3003961,"name":"Peter Johnson","username":"Peter_Johnson","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/peter_johnson/{size}/10417_2.png","created_at":"2022-02-06T22:04:51.222Z","cooked":"
WilliamB:

Also even if it did work would I have to cross compiling opencv for all the platforms I want to use it on

Yes, that’s exactly what native libraries require. You have to have a native library built and available for every platform you’re planning on running the code on. For example, for WPILib we build OpenCV 4.5.2 for every platform we support (e.g. Windows, Mac, Linux, RoboRIO, Pi, aarch64).

Re: the UnsatisfiedLinkError, what it’s looking for is a shared library named opencv_java455.so (on Linux). If it’s not installed system-wide, you’ll need to have its directory location on both java.library.path and on LD_LIBRARY_PATH. It also needs to find any dependent libraries, the ldd command can help figure this out (e.g. ldd opencv_java455.so).

ok, then I have two questions

  1. How did 401 link with just the jar?

  2. I ran sudo make install for opencv but it still isn’t finding it
